concept_definition: a road vehicle, typically with four wheels, powered by an internal combustion engine or electric motor, used for transporting passengers
A large motor vehicle designed to carry many passengers along a fixed route, typically for public transport.
a connected series of railroad cars pulled or pushed by a locomotive for transporting passengers or goods along tracks
a powered flying vehicle with fixed wings and a weight greater than that of the air it displaces, used for transporting people or cargo
A two-wheeled vehicle that a person rides by pushing pedals with their feet to propel it.
A small vessel built for transporting people across water
a large vessel built for transporting people or cargo by sea
A motor vehicle licensed to transport passengers for hire along public roads, typically operating by prearrangement or by being hailed on the street or at a taxi rank.
a large motor vehicle designed to transport goods, materials, or heavy loads; also called a lorry (chiefly British)
a two-wheeled motor vehicle powered by an engine, typically designed to be ridden by one or two people
An electronic device that processes, stores, and retrieves data, performs calculations, and runs programs to carry out various tasks.

a portable electronic device that combines a mobile phone with a handheld computer, typically offering Internet access, an operating system capable of running applications, a touchscreen interface, and multimedia functions
a portable, flat touchscreen computer that is larger than a smartphone and typically operated by touch or a stylus
A portable personal computer with a screen, keyboard, and battery, designed to be used on a person's lap or other surfaces.
a hand-held pointing device used to interact with a computer’s graphical user interface
a flat panel with keys that is used to enter characters and commands into a computer or other electronic device; (also) a musical instrument with keys similar to a piano
A device or screen used for displaying visual information from a computer or other electronic system.
a machine that produces text or images on paper or other media from digital data
A device for recording or capturing images, either as still photographs or moving video, using a light-sensitive sensor or photographic film.
a device that receives broadcast or recorded visual and audio signals and displays them as moving images and sound; also the system of broadcasting programs for such devices
a device for receiving and transmitting sound programmed broadcasts over electromagnetic waves; (also) the system of broadcasting and receiving audio signals via radio waves
a device that converts electrical audio signals into sound that can be heard; a loudspeaker
A pair of small loudspeakers worn over or in the ears to listen to audio privately.
A device used to restore electrical energy to a rechargeable battery or battery-powered device.
a device that stores chemical energy and provides electrical power to a circuit; a group of one or more electrochemical cells (e.g., AA batteries)
A global system of interconnected computer networks that use the Internet Protocol Suite (TCP/IP) to communicate and provide data and services such as the World Wide Web, email, and file sharing.
a system for sending and receiving digital messages over the internet; a message sent or received using such a system
A collection of related web pages, typically identified by a single domain name and published on at least one web server, that can be accessed via the Internet.
Online platforms and technologies that enable people to create, share, and interact with content and to communicate with each other (e.g., Facebook, Twitter, Instagram).
an electronic game played on a computer, console, or mobile device in which players interact with visual feedback on a screen
The process of designing, writing, testing, and maintaining computer code to create software or applications.
The process or activity of writing computer programs or instructions in a programming language.
Facts, measurements, or observations collected for analysis, reference, or processing; raw information that can be recorded and used for reasoning or calculation.
A system of interconnected people or things designed to exchange information, resources, or goods (e.g., a computer network connecting devices, a social network of contacts).
A computer or program that provides data, resources, or services to other computers or clients over a network.
A device used to perform mathematical calculations, usually electronic and portable.
notes: Translations given refer to the common device meaning (a calculating machine). Lithuanian: skaičiuotuvas is the standard term; kalkuliatorius is a less common variant. French calculatrice is the usual feminine noun (calculateur exists but is less common). Vietnamese máy tính can also mean "computer"; more specific "máy tính bỏ túi" or "máy tính cầm tay" = pocket calculator. Swahili kikokotoo is the common word for a (pocket) calculator. All forms are provided in their base/lemma forms.

concept_definition: A kitchen appliance with rotating blades used to mix, chop, or puree food and liquids.
notes: Commonly refers to an upright, countertop appliance for blending liquids and soft solids. Many languages also use loanwords (e.g., 'blenderis' in Lithuanian). Distinct from a food processor, which is usually for thicker chopping/slicing tasks.

concept_definition: A hand or power tool with a serrated metal blade used for cutting wood, metal, or other materials.
a weapon with a long blade
a broad piece of armor carried for protection
a flat surface on which images are displayed
a mechanical apparatus using energy to perform tasks
a long stick used as support or weapon; employees of an organization
a thing designed to inflict harm
a weapon that fires bullets
a mechanism for securing a door or container
